title: NIKE SB logo
content:
i was able to find the answer to what font NIKE is in but cannot figure out what was used for SB... any clues?

[http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/d/d4/Nike\_SB\_logo.jpeg/18...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112153440/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/d/d4/Nike_SB_logo.jpeg/180px-Nike_SB_logo.jpeg "http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/d/d4/Nike\_SB\_logo.jpeg/180px-Nike\_SB\_logo.jpeg")

 [‹ (x) Text face in old German book "Kurzes Lehrbuch der Physik" - (similar to) Monotype Modern Extended {Erik S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112153440/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30542 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) DIN-ish sans in Garden Design magazine redesign - Scene {Frank S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080112153440/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30628 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sakrojones

comments.content: Perhaps Univers Condensed Oblique skewed even more than usual?
i don’t know how to describe the difference other than to say that the SB has a straighter look. especially in the S.
Sakro your logo looks like the New Jersey Devils (Hockey) logo
yes it does... flipped the N to make an S.
